DOC.brief_summary: Fibromyalgia clinical syndrome define chronic widespread muscular pain , fatigue tenderness hyperalgesia pressure tender point . Pain associate fibromyalgia interfere daily function , work , social activity . Thus , one main treatment patient fibromyalgia must focus pain relief allow person function independently home work . Although etiology fibromyalgia unknown , clearly enhance sensitization central nervous system pain pathway demonstrate decrease pressure pain threshold , reduce central inhibition , enhance temporal summation . Reducing pain people fibromyalgia would help increase patient 's ability return work , perform activity daily live thus improve quality life patient . Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation ( TENS ) modality utilized physical therapy delivers electrical stimulation skin use acute chronic pain . TENS work reduce central excitability increase central inhibition . Thus , investigator hypothesize application Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation ( TENS ) patient Fibromyalgia ( FM ) reduce pain , reduce central excitability restore diffuse noxious inhibitory control ( DNIC ) , reduce temporal summation decrease pain and/or central excitability improve function . The primary aim study test effectiveness TENS pain central excitability crossover design study patient Fibromyalgia random assignment three treatment : treatment control , placebo TENS active high frequency TENS . A secondary aim test effect decrease pain central excitability function patient Fibromyalgia .
DOC.brief_title: Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation ( TENS ) Fibromyalgia ( FM )
DOC.detailed_description: The study simple crossover design follow three treatment ( 1 ) active TENS , ( 2 ) placebo TENS ( 3 ) treatment control randomly assign . Subjects draw order treatment ( A , B , C ) bowl initial test session . This determine order test . Each subject receive 3 treatment random order . The following tool use measure subject characteristic ( Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire , Tampa Scale Kinesiophobia ) , pain ( McGill Pain Questionnaire Visual Analogue Scale ) , central excitability ( pressure pain threshold , temporal summation DNIC ) function ( 6 minute walk test , range motion , sit stand test ) .
DOC.criteria: Fibromyalgia diagnosis physician History cervical lumbar pain TENS use last 5 year Pacemaker No use opioids
